about.heading: I am Pranav Gupta.
about.headline: Machine Learning Engineer | Software Developer
about.details: Grad student at USC majoring in Computer Science. I am keenly interested in creating and developing software that solves real-world problems. Passionate about leveraging data to make efficient decisions by predicting the future. Although most of my work experience revolves around designing data-driven software, I am open and excited to explore other areas as well. Actively looking for full-time job starting June 2020.

details.degree: Master of Science in Computer Science
details.courses: Analysis of Algorithms, Database Systems, Web Technologies, Data Mining, Natural Language Processing, AR/VR, Applied ML for Games

details.degree: Bachelor of Technology in Information Technology
details.courses: Algorithms, Web Technologies, Software Engineering, Operating Systems, Artificial Intelligence, Soft Computing

details.title: Data Engineering Fellow
points: Migrated multiple databases from Azure Data Studio to AWS S3 buckets and queried with Amazon Athena to provide a unified view of the data for a telehealth startup.
Connected the pipeline with ​Tableau​ server to create dashboards of key operational metrics that are used by company’s business analysts and strategists.

details.title: Software Engineer Intern
points: Prototyped APIs and web applications utilising Model-View-Controller architecture in ASP.NET.
Established and connected to the backend database on SQL Server.
Tested and validated proper functioning of APIs using Postman.

details.title: Software Engineer Co-op
points: Optimized a reinforcement learning model designed to send personalized messages to Call of Duty players achieving 700% more increase in average revenue per user and 2300% more increase in engagement (hours per user) as compared to human-based effortby modelling player data with Monte Carlo Tree Search and Multi-Armed Bandit algorithm in python.
Simulated players’ interaction with messages with accuracy of more than 90% on multiple KPIs by building Random Surfer model, eliminating the need to wait for players to generate data.

Prepared dataset for utilization in statistical modeling for fraud detection by querying, cleaning, and organizing large volumes of data from a Hive data warehouse and examining it to find hidden patterns.

details.title: Course Grader
points: Designed and graded homework assignments, exams, and final project for INF 510 - Principles of Programming for Data Science involving web scraping, descriptive analytics, and predictive modeling.
Held office hours to clarify doubts and provide detailed feedback to 35-40 students.

details.title: Co-Founder
points: Led conceptualization, platform creation, content generation, and marketing of an amateur blog on data science and machine learning garnering over 3000 unique readers per month; authored several articles.
Conducted multiple sessions on introductory data science and machine learning as a guest speaker at premier engineering institutes across India catering to 650 students.

details.title: Machine Learning Intern
points: Built the core recommendation platform increasing reader engagement (read ratio) by 150% by designing collaborative and content-based recommendation systems using SVD and TF-IDF.
Deployed as a real-time service through Flask connected to MongoDB database.

details.title: Data Sceince Intern
points: Optimized a reinforcement learning model designed to send personalized messages to Call of Duty players achieving 700% more increase in average revenue per user and 2300% more increase in engagement (hours per user) as compared to human-based effortby modelling player data with Monte Carlo Tree Search and Multi-Armed Bandit algorithm in python.
Simulated players’ interaction with messages with accuracy of more than 90% on multiple KPIs by building Random Surfer model, eliminating the need to wait for players to generate data.
Prepared dataset for utilization in fraud detection by querying, cleaning, and organizing data from a Hive data warehouse.
